messages.message: Hello germany! I figured we should open up talks
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Hello germany! I figured we should open up talks'.

messages.message: Yes, most certainly. I would very much like to work with you against Russia to keep him from dominating the North, and working against France together would also be great. E/G is one of my favorite alliances to play.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Yes, most certainly. I would very much like to work with you against Russia to keep him from dominating the North, and working against France together would also be great. E/G is one of my favorite alliances to play.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's enthusiasm about working together against common threats and expressing a preference for the England/Germany (E/G) alliance signals a positive intent for collaboration. The alignment with your strategic goals and the history of the E/G alliance being one of their favorites indicate a genuine interest in forming a strong partnership.

messages.message: Would you be okay with the idea of me having Hol? The fifth build can be tough for England.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Would you be okay with the idea of me having Hol? The fifth build can be tough for England.'.

messages.message: I would very much not be okay with you having Hol, it's an SC directly bordering my home. I can help you into Bel though, or help you against Russia into Sweden or St Pete for that extra SC or 2.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I would very much not be okay with you having Hol, it's an SC directly bordering my home. I can help you into Bel though, or help you against Russia into Sweden or St Pete for that extra SC or 2.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's reluctance to allow you to have Holland due to its strategic significance near their territory and the offer to assist you in other areas demonstrate a clear and honest communication about their priorities and boundaries. This indicates a straightforward approach that aligns with protecting their interests while also suggesting potential avenues for collaboration.

messages.message: Understandable but worth the ask in my opinion. Not trying to be overly aggressive.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Understandable but worth the ask in my opinion. Not trying to be overly aggressive.'.

messages.message: I don’t want to overcommit to attacking anyone this early, but I appreciate you offering support. So you don’t think you and France will be friendly?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I don’t want to overcommit to attacking anyone this early, but I appreciate you offering support. So you don’t think you and France will be friendly?'.

messages.message: As a western power I usually stay undecided as to who I really want to work with during the first year. But generally speaking I prefer an E/G over an F/G or E/F. It just makes dealing with Russia so much easier.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'As a western power I usually stay undecided as to who I really want to work with during the first year. But generally speaking I prefer an E/G over an F/G or E/F. It just makes dealing with Russia so much easier.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's explanation of their approach as a Western power, stating a preference for potential alliances like E/G over F/G or E/F, reflects a strategic mindset that considers the dynamics of the game. This response indicates a thoughtful and analytical approach to diplomacy, potentially paving the way for future collaborations that align with their strategic interests.

messages.message: Makes sense I play germany the same way, any time that I am too aggressive or get 6 in the first year I end up getting ganged up on.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Makes sense I play germany the same way, any time that I am too aggressive or get 6 in the first year I end up getting ganged up on.'.

messages.message: So Russia sent me a message asking for a deal. He said if I would help him into Sweden he would support me into North Sea after he takes Norway. This obviously raises some red flags since he is already assuming he will take Norway. I'd be surprised if he wasn't opening Moscow to St Pete.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'So Russia sent me a message asking for a deal. He said if I would help him into Sweden he would support me into North Sea after he takes Norway. This obviously raises some red flags since he is already assuming he will take Norway. I'd be surprised if he wasn't opening Moscow to St Pete.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's cautious approach to Russia's proposal and the identification of potential red flags in Russia's plan demonstrate a critical assessment of the situation. The anticipation of Russia's probable actions aligns with strategic foresight, indicating a thoughtful and skeptical stance towards potential alliances or agreements that could undermine Germany's position.

messages.message:
Okay so several countries have come to me saying that you are painting me as not wanting to work with you. That's entirely false. I have made 0 moves against you. You have attacked me. I have asked for your help against Russia, you said you would only do it if I somehow got France to help.
From my point of view I have done everything in my power to work with you, and you are spurning me at any chance you get.
Please stop working against me. Please stop spreading false ideas about me. Is there something I did to personally offend you?
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'Okay so several countries have come to me saying that you are painting me as not wanting to work with you. That's entirely false. I have made 0 moves against you. You have attacked me. I have asked for your help against Russia, you said you would only do it if I somehow got France to help.
From my point of view I have done everything in my power to work with you, and you are spurning me at any chance you get.
Please stop working against me. Please stop spreading false ideas about me. Is there something I did to personally offend you?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's detailed explanation of their perspective and the assertion of their efforts to collaborate and clarify misunderstandings support the notion of honest and earnest intentions in seeking a cooperative relationship with England. This direct and sincere communication encourages a respectful and transparent dialogue to address miscommunications and potentially rebuild trust in the alliance.

messages.message: I am not trying to spread lies, I genuinely feel as though you have no interest in working with me. I was under the impression that you said that it was “too late” for us to work together. England/Germany/France is always a 2 on 1, usually with England choosing their side. I played both and decided to go with France mainly because their plan and communication felt better. I chose wrong, and I am paying dearly for it. I apologize for doing so. At this point it feels as though you are working with France, which is inherently against me. If I have read that wrong then I apologize, but for those reasons I could not just go against Russia because in doing so I would cause a 3 on 1. That is why I asked you to get France off of me in exchange, it is the only way I survive. Otherwise it doesn’t make a difference to me if I lose and France wins or I lose and Russia wins.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I am not trying to spread lies, I genuinely feel as though you have no interest in working with me. I was under the impression that you said that it was “too late” for us to work together. England/Germany/France is always a 2 on 1, usually with England choosing their side. I played both and decided to go with France mainly because their plan and communication felt better. I chose wrong, and I am paying dearly for it. I apologize for doing so. At this point it feels as though you are working with France, which is inherently against me. If I have read that wrong then I apologize, but for those reasons I could not just go against Russia because in doing so I would cause a 3 on 1. That is why I asked you to get France off of me in exchange, it is the only way I survive. Otherwise it doesn’t make a difference to me if I lose and France wins or I lose and Russia wins.'.

messages.message: I am honestly sorry for how our game has started, and I am proposing an alliance between the two of us. I know that it will be hard for you to trust me, but I think that you can see that it is my only option, and so to betray you again would be short sighted and suicidal. If you can’t trust me, then I have no choice but to hope russia wants me as his sidekick given my navel power. I don’t want that to be my role in this game, so I hope that you will consider my proposal.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I am honestly sorry for how our game has started, and I am proposing an alliance between the two of us. I know that it will be hard for you to trust me, but I think that you can see that it is my only option, and so to betray you again would be short sighted and suicidal. If you can’t trust me, then I have no choice but to hope russia wants me as his sidekick given my navel power. I don’t want that to be my role in this game, so I hope that you will consider my proposal.'.

messages.message:
Thank you for being honest with me now. I'm not working against you at all. I am very interested in working with you, considering that I was the one who approached you and asked to work against Russia together. 
I actually felt like you didn't want to work with me, because you were saying you wouldn't work with me unless France backed off - something I cant control.
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'Thank you for being honest with me now. I'm not working against you at all. I am very interested in working with you, considering that I was the one who approached you and asked to work against Russia together. 
I actually felt like you didn't want to work with me, because you were saying you wouldn't work with me unless France backed off - something I cant control.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's acknowledgment of the newfound honesty in the communication from England and the expression of interest in a potential alliance indicate a willingness to listen and consider the proposal for collaboration. This display of open-mindedness and willingness to engage in constructive dialogue shows a readiness to explore the possibility of working together towards common goals.
